TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Pane

Docs.summary: Represents a window pane. The Pane object is a member of the Panes collection. The collection includes all the window panes for a single window.

remarks.para: Use Panes(), where is the index number, to return a single Pane object. The following example closes the active pane.
Use the Add method or the Split property to add a window pane. The following example splits the active window at 20 percent of the current window size.
The following example splits the active window in half.
You can use the SplitSpecial property to show comments, footnotes, or endnotes in a separate pane.

A window has more than one pane if the window is split or the view is not print layout view and information such as footnotes or comments are displayed. The following example displays the comments pane in normal view and then prompts to close the pane.
remarks.code: ActiveDocument.ActiveWindow.View.Type = wdNormalView If ActiveDocument.Comments.Count >= 1 Then ActiveDocument.ActiveWindow.View.SplitSpecial = wdPaneComments response = _ MsgBox("Do you want to close the comments pane?", vbYesNo) If response = vbYes Then _ ActiveDocument.ActiveWindow.ActivePane.Close End If

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Activate() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Activates the specified pane.

example.para: This example splits the active window and then activates the first pane.
example.code: Sub SplitWindow() With ActiveDocument.ActiveWindow .SplitVertical = 50 .Panes(1). Activate End WithEnd Sub

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

remarks.para: Visual Basic's CreateObject and GetObject functions give you access to an OLE Automation object from a Visual Basic for Applications project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AutoScroll([in]int32 Velocity) runtime managed

Docs.summary: Scrolls automatically through the specified pane.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool BrowseToWindow { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.BrowseToWindow : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BrowseWidth As Integer
public: property int BrowseWidth { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the width (in points) of the area in which text wraps in the specified pane. Read-only Long.

remarks.para: This property works only when you are in Web layout view.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Closes the specified Mail Merge data source, pane, or task.

example.para: This example closes the active pane if the active window is split.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created. Read-only Long.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, the Creator property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayRulers { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DisplayRulers : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if rulers are displayed for the specified pane. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: The DisplayRulers property is equivalent to the Ruler command on the View menu. If DisplayRulers is False, the horizontal and vertical rulers won't be displayed, regardless of the state of the DisplayVerticalRuler property.

example.para: This example switches the active pane to print layout view and displays the horizontal and vertical rulers.
example.code: With ActiveDocument.ActiveWindow.ActivePane .View.Type = wdPrintView . DisplayRulers = True .DisplayVerticalRuler = TrueEnd With

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayVerticalRuler { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DisplayVerticalRuler : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if a vertical ruler is displayed for the specified pane. Read/write Boolean.

remarks.para: A vertical ruler appears only in print layout view, and only if the DisplayRulers property is set to True.

example.para: This example switches the active pane to print layout view and displays the horizontal and vertical rulers.
example.code: With ActiveDocument.ActiveWindow.ActivePane .View.Type = wdPrintView .DisplayRulers = True . DisplayVerticalRuler = TrueEnd With

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Document As Document

Docs.summary: Returns a object associated with the specified pane. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Frameset As Frameset

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents an entire frames page or a single frame on a frames page. Read-only.

remarks.para: For more information on creating frames pages, see .

example.para: This example adds a new frame to the immediate right of the specified frame.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int HorizontalPercentScrolled { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.HorizontalPercentScrolled : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the horizontal scroll position as a percentage of the document width. Read/write Long.

example.para: This example horizontally scrolls the active pane of the window for Document1 all the way to the left.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Index As Integer
public: property int Index { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Long that represents the position of an item in a collection. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LargeScroll (ref object Down, ref object Up, ref object ToRight, ref object ToLeft);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LargeScroll([in]object& Down, [in]object& Up, [in]object& ToRight, [in]object& ToLeft) runtime managed
Public Sub LargeScroll (Optional ByRef Down As Object, Optional ByRef Up As Object, Optional ByRef ToRight As Object, Optional ByRef ToLeft As Object)
abstract member LargeScroll : obj * obj * obj * obj -> unit

Docs.param: The number of screens to scroll the window down.
The number of screens to scroll the window up.
The number of screens to scroll the window to the right.
The number of screens to scroll the window to the left.
Docs.summary: Scrolls a window or pane by the specified number of screens.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to clicking just before or just after the scroll boxes on the horizontal and vertical scroll bars.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MinimumFontSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MinimumFontSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the minimum font size (in points) displayed for the specified pane. Read/write Long.

remarks.para: This property only affects the text as shown in Web layout view. The point sizes that are displayed on the Formatting toolbar and used for printing aren't changed.

example.para: This example sets the active window to online view and then sets the minimum font size for the active pane to 12 points.
example.code: With ActiveDocument.ActiveWindow .View.Type = wdWebView .ActivePane. MinimumFontSize = 12End With
example.para: This example returns the minimum font size for the active pane.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void NewFrameset() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new frames page based on the specified pane.

remarks.para: For more information on creating frames pages, see .

example.para: This example opens a document named "Temp.doc" and then creates a new frames page whose only frame contains "Temp.doc".

Docs.summary: Returns a Pane object that represents the next document pane in the collection. Read-only.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Pages ^ Pages { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Pages ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the pages in a document.

Docs.param: The number of pages to be scrolled down.
The number of pages to be scrolled up.
Docs.summary: Scrolls through the specified pane or window page by page.

Docs.summary: Returns an Object that represents the parent object of the specified Pane object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Selection As Selection

Docs.summary: Returns the Selection object that represents a selection or the insertion point within a document pane. Read-only.

The number of lines to scroll the window up.
The number of lines to scroll the window to the right.
The number of lines to scroll the window to the left.
Docs.summary: Scrolls a window or pane by the specified number of lines.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void TOCInFrameset() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Creates a table of contents based on the specified document and puts it in a new frame on the left side of the frames page.

remarks.para: For more information on creating frames pages, see .

example.para: This example opens a file named "Proposal.doc", creates a frames page based on the file, and adds a frame (on the left side of the page) containing a table of contents for the file.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int VerticalPercentScrolled { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.VerticalPercentScrolled : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the vertical scroll position as a percentage of the document length. Read/write Long.

example.para: This example vertically scrolls the active pane of the window for Document1 to the end.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property View As View
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::View ^ View { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::View ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a View object that represents the view for the specified pane.

example.para: This example shows all nonprinting characters for panes associated with the first window in the Windows collection.
example.code: For Each myPane In Windows(1).Panes myPane. View .ShowAll = TrueNext myPane

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Zooms As Zooms
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Zooms ^ Zooms { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Zooms ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents the magnification options for each view (such as normal view, outline view or print layout view).

remarks.para: For information about returning a single member of a collection, see .

example.para: This example sets the magnification in normal view to 100 percent for each open window.
example.code: Dim wndLoop as Window For Each wndLoop In Windows wndLoop.ActivePane. Zooms (wdNormalView).Percentage = 100Next wndLoop
example.para: This example sets the magnification in print layout view so that an entire page is visible.
